meanings.sent1: I always preplace my school books in my bag the night before.
meanings.sent2: She preplaces the ingredients on the kitchen counter before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preplaced acorns in every corner of the garden for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The diligent student preplaces knowledge in their mind like building blocks.
meanings.sent5: Before the storm, the farmer preplaces hay in the barn to keep it dry.

meanings.definition: To replace or take the place of something before it is needed.
meanings.sent1: The new model will preplace the old one on the market next month.
meanings.sent2: He decided to preplace the broken window before winter arrived.
meanings.sent3: The magician preplaced the rabbit with a rubber duck for a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter preplaced the silence in the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The early morning sun preplaces the darkness with its warm light.
